list: üòÑDisplays the completions that have been added
list --remote: Display all available completions in the repository({{$PSCompletions.repo}})
search: search completion(wildcard character can be used)
update *: Update all completions that can be updated.
else{'It's so cool!All completions are the latest!'};
order reset:
üòÑReset the order of completion(one or more)
{{$PSCompletions.json.example.order}}
order reset *: Reset the order of all completions
config language:
Current value: en-US
üòÑGet/Set language
It will affect all completion under this module
Those who have used '{{ $PSCompletions.root_cmd }} completion' to set the completion language are not affected.
config language zh-CN: "After setting up, When adding completion,`nIt will download files from the Gitee repository($gitee)"
"Due to Gitee repository not being added, After setting up, It will still download files from the Github repository($github)"
+ "`n" + 'you can add a Gitee repository by running "'+ $PSCompletions.root_cmd + ' config gitee <repo>"'
config update:
üòÑSet whether to display remote update content when PSCompletions module is first loaded.
  1: Display updates
  0: Disable display of updates
config update 1: Display updates when PSCompletions module is first loaded.
config update 0: Disable display of updates  when PSCompletions module is first loaded.
config LRU:
Set the limit of the completion data cache,default to 5
Tips:
1. When using completion for the first time, the completion data structure in the JSON file is read and stored in the cache.
2. When the cache limit is reached, the first cached completion data will be removed.
3. Cache cleared with terminal shutdown
completion: e.g. completion git language zh-CN  --- Set the language of git completion to Chinese
ui: e.g. ui menu powershell --- use PowerShell's built-in Completions menu
ui reset: Reset all completion menu UI settings.
ui theme: üòÑToggle the theme of the completions menu
This only takes effect when using the module's built-in completion menu
ui style: üòÑSet the border style theme of the completion menu UI
ui custom color filter: üòÑForeground color of the filter box (top left).
ui custom color filter_back: üòÑBackground color of the filter box (top left).
ui custom color status: üòÑForeground color of the completion number display (lower left corner).
ui custom color status_back: üòÑBackground color of the completion number display (lower left corner).
ui custom line top_left: üòÑThe top left corner of the border
ui custom line bottom_left: üòÑThe bottom left corner of the border
ui custom line top_right: üòÑThe top right corner of the border
ui custom line bottom_right: üòÑThe bottom right corner of the border
ui custom config above_list_max:
Default to 10
Maximum number of completion items displayed on the first page when the menu UI is displayed on top.
When set to -1, it fills up all the space above
ui custom config follow_cursor:
Default to 0
üòÑSet whether the menu UI follows the cursor
That is, the bottom right corner of the cursor is the top left corner of the UI
It is not recommended to turn it on if your terminal width is small
ui custom config fast_scroll_item_count:
Default to 10
Specifies the number of completion items scrolled at once when Shift is pressed and then press up or down.
ui custom config count_symbol:
Default to /
Sets the separator for the number of complements display area.
ui custom config filter_symbol:
Default to []
Set the symbols to the left and right of the filter area
It requires two characters
Wrap in quotation marks if there are spaces,such as '[ ]'
ui custom config list_margin_right:
Default to 1ÔºåDon't use values less than 0
Set the spacing between the left completion list and the right completion tip area
(It will default to a spacing of about four spaces, with no modification provided)
ui custom config ui_margin_right:
Default to 0
Set the spacing between the completion tip area and the right menu UI border

description: For more information, please visit the following project
When you have a problem using it, you should submit an issue.
If you find the project is helpful to you, please consider giving it a <$Yellow>Star<$Cyan>!<$>
init_info:
<$Yellow>(The following content is only displayed for the first time)<$Cyan>
<$Cyan>‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®PSCompletions(<$Magenta>{{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}}<$Cyan>) --- Init successfully!‚ú®‚ú®‚ú®

Current module version: <$Magenta>{{$PSCompletions.version}}
<$Cyan>
module version logÔºö<$Blue>https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions/blob/main/module/log.json
<$Cyan>

You just need to type <$Magenta>{{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}}<$Cyan>, press <$Magenta>Space<$Cyan> and <$Magenta>Tab<$Cyan>, and you will quickly understand all commands.
Use <$Magenta>{{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} list --remote<$Cyan> to lists all completions that can be added
Use <$Magenta>{{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} add <completion><$Cyan> to add the first completion!

About UI (v3.0.0+)
 - PSCompletions does'nt use PowerShell's built-in Completions menu by default Unless you're using Windows PowerShell
   If you need it, please run <$Magenta>{{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} ui theme powershell<$Cyan> .

 - If you're not satisfied with the completion menu UI,
   you can use the commands under the <$Magenta>{{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} ui<$Cyan> to change the style

About special symbols in Completion Description
- üòÑ: After selecting and applying, Press <$Magenta>Space<$Cyan> and <$Magenta>Tab<$Cyan> to continue to get command completion.
- üòÑüòÑ: After selecting and applying, type a string without spaces, press <$Magenta>Space<$Cyan> and <$Magenta>Tab<$Cyan> to continue to get command completion.
- <$Magenta>...<$Cyan>: The description here will be filled in in the future.
   - When you use PowerShell's built-in completion menu,if <$Magenta>...<$Cyan> is the last one in the completion, it means that the display area is too small to display all completions.

PSCompletions will take up two global names(<$Yellow>You shouldn't modify them<$Cyan>)
  <$Magenta>$PSCompletions<$Cyan> => a variable name,Used to save all information related to the module.
  <$Magenta>PSCompletions<$Cyan>  => a function name,The core function of the module export.

For more information, please visit the project:
  Github: <$Blue>https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions
<$Cyan>
  Gitee:  <$Blue>https://gitee.com/abgox/PSCompletions
<$Cyan>
When you have a problem using it, you should submit an issue.
If you find the project helpful, please consider giving it a <$Yellow>Star<$Cyan>.
import_error:
<$Yellow>{{ $PSCompletions.json.module_warn}}
Completions({{ $list = $load_err_list | Foreach-Object { Split-Path (Split-Path $_ -Parent) -Leaf } }} {{$list}}) failed to load
 <$Blue>Use the following command to force the update:

 <$Magenta>{{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} update {{$list}}
repo_add:
<$Yellow>There are currently no remote repository added.It will lead to failure in adding completion.
<$Green>You can add default repository by running the following command:
<$Magenta>{{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} config github https://github.com/abgox/PSCompletions
{{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} config gitee https://gitee.com/abgox/PSCompletions
cmd_error: It's recommended to type <$Magenta>{{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}}<$Red>,press <$Magenta>Space<$Red> and <$Magenta>Tab<$Red> to complete.
module_update: (The added completion will be automatically migrated)
PSCompletions_core_info.module_updating:
<$Cyan>Successfully run the command: <$Magenta>Update-Module PSCompletions
<$Cyan>Updating PSCompletions module
PSCompletions_core_info.module_update_done: <$Green>PSCompletions module update completed.Please restart the terminal and re-import the module
module_update_err:
<$Red>PSCompletions module update failed.
Please check the reason according to the error.
Possible reasons for failureÔºö
 - Your network is bad.
 - You're using Windows Powershell, but startup privileges are too low.
    - You should use administrator privileges to start or use -Scope CurrentUser
      e.g. <$Magenta>Update-Module PSCompletions -Scope CurrentUser<$Red>
 - ...
PSCompletions_core_info.list_add_tip: <$Yellow>üü¢: You have added it.   üî¥:You haven't added it yet.
add_error:
<$Red>Completion <$Magenta>{{$_}}<$Red> isn't exist.
It's recommended to type <$Magenta>{{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} add<$Red>,press <$Magenta>Space<$Red> and <$Magenta>Tab<$Red> to complete.
Or type <$Magenta>{{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} search<$Red> to search available completions.
add_download_err:
<$Red>Completion <$Magenta>{{$completion}}<$Red> failed to add
Reason: <$Magenta>{{$completion}}<$Red> completion's file(<$Magenta>{{$fail_file}}<$Red>) download error.
Please ensure that you can access {{$fail_file_url}}
remove_err: <$Red>Remove completion <$Magenta>{{$_}}<$Red> failed. You haven't added <$Magenta>{{$_}}<$Red> yet.
It's recommended to type <$Magenta>{{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} rm<$Red>,press <$Magenta>Space<$Red> and <$Magenta>Tab<$Red> to complete.
PSCompletions_core_info.update_error: <$Red>Completion <$Magenta>{{$_}}<$Red> update failed, You haven't added <$Magenta>{{$_}}<$Red> yet.
update_download_err:
<$Red>Completion <$Magenta>{{$completion}}<$Red> failed to update
Reason: <$Magenta>{{$completion}}<$Red> completion's file(<$Magenta>{{$fail_file}}<$Red>) download error.
Please ensure that you can access {{$fail_file_url}}
update_info: {{if($add){'Add: <$Magenta>' + $add + '<$Cyan>' + "`n" + 'You can run <$Magenta>' + $PSCompletions.root_cmd + ' add <completion><$Cyan> to add completion.' + "`n`n"} }}

{{if($PSCompletions.update){'Update: <$Magenta>' + $PSCompletions.update + '<$Cyan>' + "`n" + "It's" + ' recommended to run <$Magenta>' + $PSCompletions.root_cmd + ' update *<$Cyan> to update.' + "`n`n"} }}
If you don't want to see it,please type <$Blue>{{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} config update 0<$Cyan> to disable the remote repository status.
But I don't recommend disabling it.It's a good tip.
update_has: You can update them by running the following command:
PSCompletions_core_info.update_no:
<$Cyan>----------
<$Green>It's so cool!All completions are the latest!
alias_add_done:
<$Green>The completion trigger command has been changed from <$Magenta>{{$arg[2]}}<$Green> to <$Magenta>{{$arg[3]}}<$Green>
Now you can use <$Magenta>{{$arg[3]}}<$Green> to trigger completion
(Please restart the terminal if it doesn't take effect.)
PSCompletions_core_info.alias_add_err: <$Red>Alias <$Magenta>{{$arg[-1]}} <$Red>is not available,because <$Magenta>{{$arg[-1]}}<$Magenta> <$Red>is an existing command, please set a different alias
alias_rm_done: (Please restart the terminal if it doesn't take effect.)

{{ if($PSCompletions.root_cmd -in $del_list){("`n(" + '<$Magenta>' + $PSCompletions.root_cmd + ' <$Green>is the alias for the <$Magenta>PSCompletions<$Green> module,which can only be modified and cannot be removed)')} }}
alias_reset_confirm: <$Cyan>Press Enter to remove,or any other key to abort
alias_reset_done: (Please restart the terminal if it doesn't take effect.)

{{ if($PSCompletions.root_cmd -in $del_list){("`n(" + '<$Magenta>' + $PSCompletions.root_cmd + ' <$Green>is the alias for the <$Magenta>PSCompletions<$Green> module,which can only be modified and cannot be removed)')} }}
PSCompletions_core_info.config_done: <$Magenta>{{$arg[1]}}<$Green> => <$Magenta>{{$arg[2]}}<$Green> (If it doesn't take effect, restart the terminal)
config_reset: <$Cyan>Press Enter to reset,or any other key to abort
config_reset_done: <$Green>Reset successfully,The current config is as follows:
PSCompletions_core_info.comp_lang: Set the language for the completion {{$_}}
PSCompletions_core_info.comp_done: <$Magenta>{{$arg[1]}}'s configuration item <$Magenta>{{ $arg[2] }}: <$Green>{{if($old_value){' from <$Magenta>' + $old_value +'<$Green>'}}} to <$Magenta>{{$arg[3]}}<$Green>,restart the terminal for it to take effect
PSCompletions_core_info.color_err:
<$Magenta>{{$arg[4]}}<$Red> is not a valid color value, you should use the following color values:
{{$available_color}}
PSCompletions_core_info.filter_symbol_err:
<$Red>It requires two characters,such as <$Magenta>[]<$Red>
Wrap in quotation marks if there are spaces,such as <$Magenta>'[ ]'
PSCompletions_core_info.ui_menu_done: <$Green>{{if($PSCompletions.ui.config.enable_ui){'Enable the module built-in completion menu'}else{'Disable the module built-in completion menu, and will use <$Magenta>PowerShell<$Green> built-in completion menu'} }}
PSCompletions_core_info.ui_reset_done: <$Green>All completion menu UI settings are reverted to default!
which_err: It's recommended to type <$Magenta>{{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} which<$Red>,press <$Magenta>Space<$Red> and <$Magenta>Tab<$Red> to complete.
less_tip: <$Cyan>üîîPress Enter to view more, or any other key to exit!(<$Magenta>{{$lines}}<$Cyan> lines remaining)üîî
PSCompletions_core_info.comp_hide:
‚ö†Ô∏èDue to the limited display area size, some completions have been hidden‚ö†Ô∏è
You can filter by typing the prefix of the completion and pressing Tab

search:
e.g. {{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} search *    Show all
    {{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} search p*   Search for completion starting with p
    {{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} search *p*  Search for completion with p in the name
update:
e.g. {{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} update              => check available update
    {{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} update *            => update all
    {{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} update <completion> => update completions
alias:
e.g. {{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} alias list
    {{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} alias add git g
    {{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} alias rm g
config: e.g. {{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} config language         => Get language, it should return en-US
{{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} config language zh-CN   => Set language to zh-CN
completion: e.g. completion git language en-US  --- Set the language of git completion to English
ui:
e.g. {{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} ui menu powershell --- use PowerShell's built-in Completions menu
     {{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} ui menu default    --- use module's built-in Completions menu
     {{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} ui theme default   --- use default theme
     {{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} ui custom          --- custom
ui_menu: e.g. {{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} ui menu powershell --- use PowerShell's built-in Completions menu
{{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} ui menu default    --- use module's built-in Completions menu
ui_theme: e.g. {{$PSCompletions.root_cmd}} ui theme default  --- default theme
